speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's official.  Once again, there is no room for me at the Yo-Yo Ma Orchestral Fantasy Camp.  Hello.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, this is my cousin Jen.  She's visiting this week, remember?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, of course.  So how are you enjoying Seattle?

speaker: Jen
text: Well, I've been living in London, so Seattle seems a little lame. No offense.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, none taken.  So you like London?

speaker: Jen
text: Not really.  It's like a parody of itself.

speaker: Frasier
text: How so?

speaker: Jen
text: Oh, you know, double decker buses, bobbies, little pubs.  It's like EPCOT but even fakier.  So I bailed.  Went and spent some time in Florence.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, _Firenze_.  How is she?

speaker: Jen
text: I gotta say, Florence is over.  It was probably cool, before all the Americans found out about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean three hundred years ago?

speaker: Jen
text: Exactly.  That's why I'm going to Vietnam.  Americans have never even heard of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  Well, you know, I'm afraid I have to bail on this conversation, I have a show to prepare for.  Roz, when are we doing those promos?  This evening?  [_He heads for Roz's side of the booth, they follow him._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I had to reschedule those 'cause Jen and I are goin' out tonight!

speaker: Jen
text: A guy I met on the internet is in a band.  We're going to go check them out, have a few drinks, watch all the losers.  Wanna come?

speaker: Frasier
text: While no stranger to the discoth�que, I'm afraid it will have to Be you and Roz this evening.

speaker: Jen
text: This is our first time going out since I was a kid.  When she used To baby-sit me, she was always dragging me on some wild adventure.  Like that time we changed the sign from "SCHOOL ASSEMBLY" to "COOL ASS"?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God.

speaker: Frasier
text: Charming.

speaker: Jen
text: No, you don't understand.  The town we grew up in, was totally boring.  It was like Kill Yourself, USA, right?  Roz was the only person who did anything fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that so?

speaker: Jen
text: Yeah.  My mom calls me "Roz Junior," which is what passes for wit where we come from.

speaker: Roz
text: And, our town has the world's... Together:  FOURTH LARGEST THERMOMETER!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I can see why London really let you down.  [_He goes back to his side of the booth and closes the door as Kenny comes in the other._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Kenny.

speaker: Kenny
text: Remember last month when you spent your whole show talking to that pregnant teenager?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, it wasn't a total waste.  We just got nominated for an Excellence in Broadcasting Decency Award.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, that is quite an honor.  I don't think we've ever won one of those.  [_He sits._]

speaker: Kenny
text: It's a very prestigious award.  That's what makes it so special when they call your name.  You know, it's heavier than it looks. You don't want to drop one of those on your foot, let me tell you.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you won one.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, it's in a box in my office.  You can come by sometime and I'll show you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Honestly, Kenny, when are you going to unpack those boxes?  Isn't Four years enough time to make that office your own?

speaker: Kenny
text: Negatory, Doc.  Every time I unpack in a new job, I get fired. Tacoma, Moline, Moline again... I learned my lesson; those boxes stay packed.

speaker: Frasier
text: So that's why you haven't unpacked.  You know, all this time, I've been using you on my radio show as an example of procrastination. I had no idea you were just living in fear.

speaker: Kenny
text: I prefer to see it as a healthy superstition.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, there's no such thing as a healthy superstition.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh yeah?  What do you call washing your hands after you go to the bathroom?  [_He leaves as Frasier is left without an answer.  Fade out._]  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  [_Fade in.  Martin is watching baseball on TV when Frasier comes in from his room.  The living room is a mess._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Look at this place.  Dad, I don't believe you've thrown out a single paper since Daphne moved in with Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, it was your idea to split up the chores.  Recycling is your deal.  Recycling and floors, remember?  I'm in charge of regular garbage and tabletops, both of which are nicely under control, I might add.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  I count three snack plates around your chair, all of them on tabletops.  [_Martin grunts, then gathers the plates in a stack and puts them on the floor._]

speaker: Martin
text: Not anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, what's it gonna take for you to start doing your share of the work around here?

speaker: Martin
text: [_thoughtfully_]  Trade me floors for garbage.

speaker: Frasier
text: You'll really take care of all the floors if I handle the garbage?

speaker: Martin
text: That's right.  [_The doorbell rings and Frasier rises slowly while giving him a calculating look._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  Okay, you got a deal, Mister.  [_He opens the door to reveal Daphne._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  Why's all your garbage stacked up in the hallway?  [_Frasier looks outside, stunned._]

speaker: Martin
text: That's right, why is that, Frasier?  [_Frasier glares at him and closes the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Your game is deep.

speaker: Daphne
text: My, things are a bit untidy around here, aren't they?  Maybe I'll Just clean up these dishes before we get started.  [_She grabs the plates and heads for the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you don't have to do that.

speaker: Martin
text: That's true.  You're not our slave anymore.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not gonna do all of it, just the tabletops.  [_She goes into the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: Aw, that's sweet of you.  [_He smugly grins at Frasier._]

speaker: Martin
text: Burn.  [_Frasier stands there fuming.  Fade out._]  Scene 3 - Cafe Nervosa  [_Fade in.  Roz and Jen are at a table, Frasier and Niles are standing around looking for a place to sit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there's room at Roz's table.

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  I find her cousin Jen just a bit judgmental for my taste. Yesterday she told me my show was bourgeois.  I pointed out that anything that had mass appeal could be said to be bourgeois.  She then said that my argument was bourgeois.  Which I found to be jejeune.

speaker: Niles
text: People in their twenties are always like that.  The world is so daunting at that age.  They comfort themselves with the idea that everything's just trash.  We were like that in medical school. Acting as if we were above it all, smarter than everybody.  It passes.  [_They go over to Roz's table._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Niles, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Come join us.  Jen, this is Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Pleased to meet you.

speaker: Jen
text: "Niles", whoa.  Thanks Mom and Dad, right?  [_Niles seems perturbed but he and Frasier sit anyway._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Jen, good to see you again.  So, how was our night out, girls?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it's still goin' on!  We went to this really great club called Zoo.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, The Zoo?

speaker: Roz
text: No, it was just called Zoo.  [_Jen lets out a snort._]

speaker: Jen
text: Huh, "The".  [_She and Roz laugh._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, is that glitter in your hair?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, is it?  I thought it all came out in the car wash.  [_She heads for the ladies room.  Jen's cell phone rings and she answers it._]

speaker: Jen
text: Oh, that's mine.  Hello? ... Oh, Anka.  You won't believe what huge Seattle cliche I'm in right now. ... I swear, my cousin Roz is like the only cool person in this whole city.  The rest are just drones. Apparently they don't believe in raw sugar.  [_rising_]  Excuse me.  [_She heads away._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You see what I mean about her.

speaker: Niles
text: She's struggling through a typical phase of development.  Stop being so sensitive.  [_Jen comes back with sugar packets.  Niles rises as she sits._]

speaker: Jen
text: Sorry about that.

speaker: Niles
text: Not at all.  [_The waiter brings Niles and Frasier's coffees._]

speaker: Jen
text: So, tell me about you guys.  Roz says you're super competitive with each other.  Did your parents withhold affection or is just the penis thing?

speaker: Niles
text: [_to waiter_]  Uh, I'll take mine to go.  [_Frasier looks on smugly.  Fade out._]  Scene 4 - KACL  [_Fade in.  Frasier is on the air._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Coming up next, This Day in Psychological History.  After the news.  [_Roz comes in from her side, yawning._]

speaker: Roz
text: It was a good show, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not over Roz, this is just a break.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, I'm so exhausted.  I haven't slept since Jen got here.  [_Jen comes in ._]

speaker: Jen
text: Hey, Roz, wanna go watch some backyard wrestling tonight?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know.  Maybe we should stay in tonight...rent a video?

speaker: Jen
text: Rent a video?  You're turning into Aunt Mirabelle.  All you need is a beanbag ashtray and a tracheotomy.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'm not there yet. I just thought that maybe you could use a night off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say there, Jen, did you have a chance to explore that art gallery I suggested?

speaker: Jen
text: Yeah.  I know you're into that stuff so I don't want to put it down.  But it was like everything in there was trying to make us feel better about our corrupt, imperialistic, phallocratic heritage.

speaker: Frasier
text: They're landscapes.

speaker: Jen
text: But I picked up something for you on the way over here.  [_She hands him a shopping bag._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_]  Really?

speaker: Jen
text: Mm-hm.  [_He reaches in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... a bust of Freud.  Well, that's really quite thoughtful of you.

speaker: Jen
text: I figured you'd appreciate the irony.  Since he's been proven wrong about practically everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: I like to think that Freud's theories will withstand the test of time.

speaker: Jen
text: Really?  Have you read either of his books?

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, young lady...

speaker: Jen
text: Uh-oh, here comes the lecture.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, for once you are right, for a disquisition is indeed at hand. And may I suggest you roll your eyes back into the forward position, as I may actually employ some visual aids.  Now, our story begins with a young Greek woman of the name Clytemnestra...  [_N.B. In classical literature, the wife of King Agamemnon, who killed her husband when he returned from the Trojan Wars and ran off with her lover._]  [_Kenny comes into the booth._]

speaker: Roz
text: Look, everybody, Kenny's here!

speaker: Kenny
text: Wow, I've never heard that before.

speaker: Roz
text: Jen, maybe Kenny can show you around the station.

speaker: Jen
text: You already showed me around the station yesterday.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, but you know what?  I totally forgot to show you our ratings binders.

speaker: Kenny
text: You did?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, then you're in for a treat.  [_Jen starts out the door then notices what Kenny is holding._]

speaker: Jen
text: What's that trophy for?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, a little series I produced called "Life Is My Favorite Drug of All".

speaker: Jen
text: Sounds pretty lame.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_pauses_]  Yeah, it was.  [_They leave and Roz closes the door behind them._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, that girl is really getting under my skin.  When is she leaving?

speaker: Roz
text: She's not that bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Roz, she's running you ragged.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, please, this is nothing.  I used to party every night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, sure, at twenty you can do anything.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, there's still a lot of candy left in this pinata.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's attractive.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  [_She goes to her side, closing the door behind her.  Fade out._]  Scene 5 - KACL  [_Fade in.  Kenny opens the door to his office and leads Jen in._]

speaker: Kenny
text: And this is my office.  The nerve center.  Where it all gdoes down.

speaker: Jen
text: Did you just move in here or something?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, no.  No, but in AM radio you've got to be ready to go in a moment's notice.  One day you're operating a fifty thousand watt powerhouse in Cleveland, the next your spinning platters out of a barn in Tulsa Town.  You've gotta keep movin', it's all about the music.  When it isn't about news and talk.

speaker: Jen
text: I heard AM radio is dead.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, it is.  So, you're going to Vietnam?

speaker: Jen
text: I'm thinking about it.

speaker: Kenny
text: That's such an original choice.  You're so cool.

speaker: Jen
text: You're the first person that hasn't thought I was totally crazy for wanting to go there.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, what do they know?  I've always loved the idea of just taking off.  You know, seeing someplace exotic.

speaker: Jen
text: Why haven't you?

speaker: Kenny
text: My wife.  She didn't like to travel.

speaker: Jen
text: But you just said you were separated.  So do it.  Blow all of it off, go to Vietnam.  Break out of this prison cell.

speaker: Kenny
text: I could, couldn't I?  You know, I could just be free.  Just get a motorcycle, drive around the countryside, really start to live.

speaker: Jen
text: I never even thought of the motorcycle.  Now you have to do it.

speaker: Kenny
text: People would think I was nuts.

speaker: Jen
text: I wouldn't.  [_Cut to - Frasier's booth.  He is on the air, speaking passionately._]

speaker: Frasier
text: When Freud's genius has OBVIOUSLY influenced every psychiatrist on the planet...  [_Roz gestures in surrender._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I haven't forgotten about you, callers.  Stay tuned, won't you?  [_He punches out and takes off his headset as Roz comes over to his side._]

speaker: Roz
text: I'm starting to feel guilty about pawning Jen off on Kenny like that.  He's been a little down lately, and Jen can be a little, well, negative sometimes.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hadn't noticed.

speaker: Roz
text: I just hope she doesn't send him spiraling down into some  kind of depression.  [_Cut to - Kenny's office.  He and Jen are on the couch, necking furiously._]  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa  [_Fade in.  Jen and Roz are at a table together.  Jen is staring at another customer._]

speaker: Jen
text: So, Seattle still loves the Walkman, huh?  He's probably listening to "Thriller".  So, do you still want to go to that warehouse party tonight?  Doors open at eleven, so we should probably be there at one.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, I wish I could Jen, but I really have to sleep.

speaker: Jen
text: Don't worry, we'll have a few cocktails and you'll feel a lot better.

speaker: Roz
text: Forget it, I am not drinking again tonight.

speaker: Jen
text: So just drink beer.  I mean, Alice is still at her grandparent's, right?

speaker: Roz
text: Listen sweety, why don't you go out by yourself tonight.

speaker: Jen
text: Oh, come on, Mirabelle, have some fun.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't do that.

speaker: Jen
text: Do what, Mirabelle?

speaker: Roz
text: Knock it off, I'm serious.

speaker: Jen
text: You used to be so fun, but ever since you've got the condo and the SUV, you're all 401(k) or whatever.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm exactly the same person I've always been.

speaker: Jen
text: Oh, yeah?  I checked your car radio.  It's not stuck on that classic rock station.

speaker: Roz
text: For your information, classic rock is both classic and it rocks.

speaker: Jen
text: What happened to you?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm old!  [_They both drink their coffee uncomfortably.  Fade out._]  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  [_Fade in.  Martin is watching TV, Frasier is on the couch.  Daphne is straightening up.  The doorbell rings._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, would you get that?  [_She does.  It is Niles._]

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry I'm late, I...  [_He notices her apron._]

speaker: Niles
text: What's going on?  [_Martin and Frasier share a worried look._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-oh.

speaker: Martin
text: Steady...

speaker: Daphne
text: Your father and brother needed a little help.  The oven's all clean, I just have a bit of ironing left, I won't be a minute. And don't forget:  I've drawn baths for both of you.  [_Frasier and Martin weakly protest this.  She hurries off.  Niles stares at the other two, who avoid his gaze._]

speaker: Niles
text: Are you proud of yourselves?

speaker: Frasier
text: We didn't ask her to do anything.

speaker: Martin
text: She offered.

speaker: Niles
text: Then why is no one looking me in the eye?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Niles, you're right.  Maybe we took advantage.

speaker: Martin
text: Absolutely.  We're way out of line, it won't happen again.  [_He tosses his popcorn bowl on the floor._]

speaker: Niles
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: Are you going to leave that there?

speaker: Martin
text: I'll clean it later.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's the whole problem.  If you would just clean as you go, things wouldn't pile up, you wouldn't need Daphne's help.

speaker: Martin
text: I guess.

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's true, look at this.  Look how easy.  [_He picks up the bowl and Frasier's from the coffee table, and heads for the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: See?  Small, consistent efforts, that's what it takes.  Just like managing one's cuticles.  [_He reaches the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_calling_]  You know, there's a bowl of potato salad laying out, completely uncovered.

speaker: Martin
text: It's getting tangy.

speaker: Niles
text: The plastic wrap is right here.

speaker: Frasier
text: We really should help him.

speaker: Martin
text: Are you nuts?  He's about to make us dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: He is not.

speaker: Martin
text: Twenty bucks says he is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Forget money.  Let's wager something real.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, if I get him to make dinner, you do all the chores.  If I don't, I'll do 'em.  [_Daphne comes back out._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm ready, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_returning from the kitchen._]  Excellent, because tonight I am taking you to the finest bistro in the Pacific Northwest.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're on!

speaker: Martin
text: Take your sweet time, why don't you?!  [_calling out_]  Hey, guys, Are you sure you don't want to stick around?  I was just going to open a can of spaghetti.

speaker: Niles
text: [_stopping at the door_]  But, you have sea bass in the fridge.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it'll probably last another day.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I think you should cook it tonight.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine.  I'll nuke it with some ketchup.  [_Frasier looks on warily._]

speaker: Niles
text: That's ridiculous.  You can't use your turkey recipe on fish.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what am I supposed to do?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, just take one clove of garlic, two tablespoons of finely minced fresh ginger...  [_off Martin's confused look_]  Oh, for heaven's sake, I'll do it myself.  [_He heads for the kitchen, Daphne closes the door._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose I'll lay the table.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no Daphne.  You've done enough for today.  That's Frasier's job.  [_He sits smugly as an irate Frasier gets up.  Fade out._]  Scene 3 - KACL  **HE'S ALSO SEEN BOSTON AND KANSAS**  [_Fade in.  Kenny is in his office, snacking and listening to Frasier on the speaker._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] And so for our final hour today, I'd like to focus on First-time callers only.  We've heard a lot of familiar voices this week and I'd like to shake it up...  [_Jen comes in the door._]

speaker: Jen
text: Hey.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey.  [_He gets up and turns the speaker down._]

speaker: Kenny
text: I looked for you at that warehouse party last night, but I didn't see you.

speaker: Jen
text: Oh, I was in the old meat locker.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, I didn't look in there.

speaker: Jen
text: Sorry we didn't hook up.  Did I leave my sunglasses in here?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, yes, you did.  [_He gets them out of his desk._]

speaker: Jen
text: So, I'm taking off.  I had a really cool time with you.  I hope you make your break from here soon.

speaker: Kenny
text: Good news.  I just got off the phone with my travel agent.  She got me this great fare to Ho Chi Minh City and she said it'd be no problem to get you on the same flight.  This is gonna be awesome! I've never seen Asia before.  I've seen the band, of course, but not, you know...

speaker: Jen
text: Oh, well, about that, Kenny, um, I already booked a flight.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, well maybe I can get on your flight.

speaker: Jen
text: Well, see, the thing is, I travel solo.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh.

speaker: Jen
text: It's kind of a rule I have.  I had this bad experience once...

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, no, please.  I totally get where you're coming from.  Solo's the way to go.  My high school French club went to Montreal once, nightmare!

speaker: Jen
text: You should still go.  You deserve to have some fun.

speaker: Kenny
text: Okay.  Yeah.  Well, maybe I'll run into you over there.

speaker: Jen
text: I'd like that.  [_She kisses him on the cheek and leaves.  Kenny looks around wistfully and turns the speaker back up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._]  Our next caller is Stu, from Madrona. Go ahead, Stu, I'm listening.  [_Cut to - Frasier's booth as Stu speaks._]

speaker: Stu
text: [_v.o._]  All right, it's like this:  I've been dating my girlfriend for six years and she keeps bugging me about movin' in..  But I know as soon as she does, my freedom is gone.  Everything's gotta be in the hamper, I can't eat over the sink, can't just go out whenever my buddies call, it's a lot to give up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, Stu, how old are you?

speaker: Stu
text: The calendar says forty-seven, but I feel eighteen, right?

speaker: Roz
text: Forty-seven?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: I have a suggestion for you, Stu:  Grow the hell up!

speaker: Stu
text: What?  I'm sorry?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm thirty-eight.  And I FEEL thirty-eight.  Now, I know we're all supposed to act like perpetual teenagers these days, but you know what?  I like acting my age.  I like being a mom.  I like having a career.  And I like balancing my checkbook!  When did it become such a bad thing to be an adult?!

speaker: Stu
text: Dr. Crane?  Hello?

speaker: Roz
text: Now, don't get me wrong, I had a great time when I was younger, I did!  But after a while, that way of life just seems...empty.  You have to go deeper, and commit to things that really matter to you. Believe me, when you do that, you'll find out how amazing and rich life can be.

speaker: Stu
text: Hey, I know that voice.  You were at Zoo the other night.  [_Roz Looks nervous._]  You told me you were twenty-nine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for your call, Stu, let's go to traffic.  [_He punches off, removes his headphones and goes over to Roz's side._]

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, Frasier.  I guess I shouldn't have unloaded on that guy.  I've just been thinking a lot about age lately.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's all right, Roz.  I thought your speech was courageous.  And Who knows?  Even if it went right past Stu, maybe it reached somebody else out there on the Frasier Crane Radio Network.  [_They share a laugh.  Cut to - Kenny's office.  He is staring out the window, the speaker still on in the background.  He turns and shuts it off.  He then starts unpacking his boxes.  Fade out._]
